item.title: SNAP benefits: Appeals court again rejects Trump admin bid to halt full payment order
item.description: The question of whether the Trump administration can be compelled to pay 42 million Americans full food stamp benefits is set to return to the Supreme...

item.title: Trump pardons Rudy Giuliani and others who backed efforts to overturn 2020 election, official says
item.description: President Donald Trump has pardoned Rudy Giuliani, Mark Meadows and others accused of backing efforts to overturn the 2020 election.

item.title: Government shutdown could be headed for end as Senate passes first stage of new deal
item.description: The U.S. government shutdown has dragged on for weeks because of the refusal by Democrats in the Senate to approve a bill that does not extend ACA tax...

item.title: Trump administration demands that states 'undo' full SNAP benefit payments
item.description: The Trump administration has resisted continuing the SNAP program, which provides food stamps to 42 million Americans, during the government shutdown.

item.title: Senate leader eyes potential shutdown deal but there's no guarantee of success
item.description: The GOP leader said a potential deal was "coming together" on the government shutdown but there was no guarantee it would end the impasse.
